Quotes: The secret to creativity is knowing how to hide your sources.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Never do anything against conscience even if the state demands it.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: When a thing has been said and well, have no scruple. Take it and copy it.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: There are very honest people who do not think that they have had a bargain unless they have cheated a merchant.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: A civilization is built on what is required of men, not on that which is provided for them.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

Quotes: Imagination decides everything.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: The whole difference between construction and creation is exactly this: that a thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed;but a thing created is loved before it exists.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Before beginning, plan carefully.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: No one was ever great without some portion of divine inspiration.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Fashion is made to become unfashionable.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: Those who create are rare;those who cannot are numerous. Therefore, the latter are stronger.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: From a little spark may burst a flame.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quotes: Word is a shadow of a deed.
Author: Democritus

Quotes: One must still have chaos in oneself to be able to give birth to a dancing star.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: When one has not had a good father, one must create one.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: In large states public education will always be mediocre, for the same reason that in large kitchens the cooking is usually bad.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Kings are not born: they are made by artificial hallucination.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Nothing is worth doing unless the consequences may be serious.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Science never solves a problem without creating ten more.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Enthusiasm is the yeast that makes your hopes shine to the stars. Enthusiasm is the sparkle in your eyes, the swing in your gait. The grip of your hand, the irresistible surge of will and energy to execute your ideas.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Objects in pictures should so be arranged as by their very position to tell their own story.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Magic is believing in yourself, if you can do that, you can make anything happen.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Great indeed is the sublimity of the Creative, to which all beings owe their beginning and which permeates all heaven.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quotes: A change in the weather is sufficient to recreate the world and ourselves.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: Let us consider the critic, therefore, as a discoverer of discoveries.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: Of all follies there is none greater than wanting to make the world a better place.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: Benefits should be conferred gradually;and in that way they will taste better.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: As the builders say, the larger stones do not lie well without the lesser.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Necessity... the mother of invention.
Author: Plato

Quotes: You've got to jump off cliffs and build your wings on the way down.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: Chance is a word void of sense;nothing can exist without a cause.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: I try to build a full personality for each of our cartoon characters - to make them personalities.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: You can design and create, and build the most wonderful place in the world. But it takes people to make the dream a reality.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: The lady doth protest too much, methinks.
Author: William Shakespeare
